visualization_prompt: Create a Highcharts chartOptions object to render a 3D column range chart. The chart should display temperature variations by month for Vik i Sogn, Norway, in 2009. The chart should have a title 'Temperature variation by month' and a subtitle 'Observed in Vik i Sogn, Norway, 2009'. The x-axis should be labeled with month names, and the y-axis should be labeled 'Temperature ( °C )'. The tooltip should display the temperature values with the suffix '°C'. The chart should use 3D effects with specific angles and depth. The legend should be disabled, and the chart should have a margin of 75 pixels. The data series should include temperature ranges for each month.

subtitle.text: Observed in Vik i Sogn, Norway, 2009

visualization_explanation: The provided Highcharts chartOptions object is configured to render a 3D column range chart that visualizes temperature variations by month for Vik i Sogn, Norway, in 2009. The chart type is set to 'columnrange', which is suitable for displaying ranges of data. The chart includes 3D effects with specific angles (alpha and beta set to 15 degrees) and a depth of 50 pixels. The title and subtitle provide context about the data being displayed. The x-axis is labeled with month names, and the y-axis is labeled 'Temperature ( °C )'. The tooltip displays temperature values with the suffix '°C'. The plotOptions for the column range include a depth of 25 pixels. The legend is disabled, and the chart has a margin of 75 pixels to ensure all elements are clearly visible. The data series includes temperature ranges for each month, making it easy to compare the temperature variations throughout the year.
